title: Model Tara Moss, 45, is hardly recognisable on The Morning Show
text:
Over the past few years, model Tara Moss has transformed herself from a blonde bombshell into a rockabilly queen.

And on Friday, the 45-year-old showed off her dramatic new style as she discussed her latest novel on The Morning Show.

While she looked very different from her '90s modelling heyday, Tara nonetheless oozed sophistication as she channelled retro-inspired fashion.

My, how you've changed! Former model Tara Moss, 45, looked hardly recognisable during an appearance on Channel Seven's The Morning Show on Friday

Looking like she'd just stepped out of a time machine from the 1940s, Tara wore cherry lipstick and smokey dark eyeshadow for her TV appearance.

She also added a touch of colour to her pale complexion with rose blush and twisted her hair into gorgeous curls to shape her face.

Tara accessorised with dazzling emerald green earrings which perfectly matched her stylish cut-out top.

Back in the day: Over the past few years, Tara has transformed herself from a blonde bombshell into a rockabilly queen. Pictured on June 4, 2008 in Los Angeles

Tara has left behind the fashion catwalk to focus on writing crime novels, with her latest book being Dead Man Switch, which is set in 1940s Australia.

Speaking about the novel, she said: 'This is my twelfth book... I have taken the time to research and think about my next crime heroine.

'I chose 1946 Sydney. Billie Walker is my main protagonist, and she is an extraordinary woman - she's got grit, she's tough, and she's a social woman in a time of change.'

New look, who dis? While she looked very different from her '90s modelling heyday, Tara nonetheless oozed sophistication as she channelled retro-inspired fashion

As part of her rockabilly transformation, Tara has also invested in several tattoos, including a large design that takes up most of her upper arm.

The tattoo appears to consist of the word 'Mother' surrounded by flowers and birds and is inspired by the classic Sailor Jerry style preferred by sailors.

In December, Tara celebrated nine years of marital bliss with photographer Berndt Sellheim, with whom she shares eight-year-old daughter Sapphira Jane.
description: Over the past few years, model Tara Moss has transformed herself from a blonde bombshell to a rockabilly queen.
authors: Nicole Douglas For Daily Mail Australia
